articles.headline: Stock Buybacks That Hurt Shareholders
articles.snippet: Not all stock buybacks are the same. Some can be quite costly and destroy value rather than create it.
articles.abstract: Not all stock buybacks are the same. Some can be quite costly and destroy value rather than create it.
articles.lead_paragraph: We’re in a stock buyback binge. Companies are tripping over themselves to repurchase their own shares this year, and most investors see this as a bonanza.

articles.headline: House Value Jumping? Save Your Home Improvement Receipts
articles.snippet: Solid gains in home values mean more homeowners could face a hefty tax when they sell. Keeping track of home improvement costs could help defray that tax.
articles.abstract: Solid gains in home values mean more homeowners could face a hefty tax when they sell. Keeping track of home improvement costs could help defray that tax.
articles.lead_paragraph: A tax time bomb is ticking for an increasing number of people who have been lucky enough to see big gains in the values of their homes.

articles.headline: Safety Agency Admits Missing Clues to G.M. Ignition Defects
articles.snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration identified a series of failings that allowed millions of small cars to go unfixed for more than a decade.
articles.abstract: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration identified a series of failings that allowed millions of small cars to go unfixed for more than a decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ever since General Motors began recalling cars with a defective ignition switch that has been linked to at least 109 deaths, Mary T. Barra, its chief executive, has repeatedly apologized for the automaker’s failings in what became the gravest safety crisis in its history.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Rebecca R. Ruiz

articles.headline: Walmart, Lagging in Online Sales, Is Strengthening E-Commerce
articles.snippet: Trailing Amazon in e-commerce sales, Walmart is starting a new online shipping program, hiring tech employees and pledging to invest $1 billion in online operations.
articles.abstract: Trailing Amazon in e-commerce sales, Walmart is starting a new online shipping program, hiring tech employees and pledging to invest $1 billion in online operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. — In the world of brick and mortar, Walmart is a titan, ringing up more than $1 billion of sales a day.

articles.headline: Grim Reality: Czech TV Makes Game of Nazi Era
articles.snippet: A Czech series has, not surprisingly, stirred intense reactions about mixing such a dark period in history into an entertainment format more often associated with the Kardashians.
articles.abstract: A Czech series has, not surprisingly, stirred intense reactions about mixing such a dark period in history into an entertainment format more often associated with the Kardashians.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — We have seen toddlers in tiaras, been left “Naked and Afraid” and met more real housewives than a postman.

articles.headline: SEAL Team 6: A Secret History of Quiet Killings and Blurred Lines
articles.snippet: The unit best known for killing Osama bin Laden has been converted into a global manhunting machine with limited outside oversight.
articles.abstract: The unit best known for killing Osama bin Laden has been converted into a global manhunting machine with limited outside oversight.
articles.lead_paragraph: They have plotted deadly missions from secret bases in the badlands of Somalia. In Afghanistan, they have engaged in combat so intimate that they have emerged soaked in blood that was not their own. On clandestine raids in the dead of the night, their weapons of choice have ranged from customized carbines to primeval tomahawks.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti, Nicholas Kulish, Christopher Drew, Serge F. Kovaleski, Sean D. Naylor and John Ismay

articles.headline: Transgender Children’s Books Fill a Void and Break a Taboo
articles.snippet: Mainstream publishing houses are increasingly giving visibility to transgender authors and their books, which are aimed at broader and younger audiences.
articles.abstract: Mainstream publishing houses are increasingly giving visibility to transgender authors and their books, which are aimed at broader and younger audiences.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sam Martin was browsing in a Boston record store 23 years ago when an unusual photography book caught his eye. Mr. Martin flipped through its pages, which featured portraits and interviews with women who had become men, and started to cry.

articles.headline: Dennis Hastert Rushed to Make Money as Payouts Grew
articles.snippet: The former speaker of the House became more active in his lobbying firm at about the time that, according to a federal indictment, he began making large payments to a man known as “Individual A.”
articles.abstract: The former speaker of the House became more active in his lobbying firm at about the time that, according to a federal indictment, he began making large payments to a man known as “Individual A.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After a relatively slow start to his career as a consultant and lobbyist, J. Dennis Hastert, the former speaker of the House of Representatives, became very busy in 2010. He was traveling to spots including Singapore and Montreal, meeting with clients about ventures as varied as futures trading and Formula One racing.

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton Traces Friendly Path, Troubling Party
articles.snippet: Ms. Clinton appears to be dispensing with the nationwide strategy that won her husband two terms in the White House, opting instead to retrace Barack Obama’s narrower path.
articles.abstract: Ms. Clinton appears to be dispensing with the nationwide strategy that won her husband two terms in the White House, opting instead to retrace Barack Obama’s narrower path.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hillary Rodham Clinton appears to be dispensing with the nationwide electoral strategy that won her husband two terms in the White House and brought white working-class voters and great stretches of what is now red-state America back to Democrats.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Deutsche Bank Co-Chief Executives Resign
articles.snippet: Anshu Jain and Jürgen Fitschen will be replaced by John Cryan, former chief financial officer of the Swiss bank UBS, Deutsche Bank said on Sunday.
articles.abstract: Anshu Jain and Jürgen Fitschen will be replaced by John Cryan, former chief financial officer of the Swiss bank UBS, Deutsche Bank said on Sunday.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Even as other European banks reduced their presence on Wall Street in the face of new regulations and legal challenges, Deutsche Bank has been the exception.

articles.headline: Erdogan’s Governing Party in Turkey Loses Parliamentary Majority
articles.snippet: The election results represented a significant setback to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, an Islamist who has steadily increased his power.
articles.abstract: The election results represented a significant setback to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, an Islamist who has steadily increased his power.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Turkish voters delivered a rebuke on Sunday to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan as his party lost its majority in Parliament in a historic election that thwarted his ambition to rewrite Turkey’s Constitution and further bolster his clout.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Ceylan Yeginsu

articles.headline: Protections for Late Investors Can Inflate Start-Up Valuations
articles.snippet: Terms providing insurance against subsequent developments appeal to company founders because they provide new cash at the highest nominal valuation, reducing dilution if all goes well.
articles.abstract: Terms providing insurance against subsequent developments appeal to company founders because they provide new cash at the highest nominal valuation, reducing dilution if all goes well.
articles.lead_paragraph: Warning: Some unicorns may be smaller than they appear.

articles.headline: States Confront Wide Budget Gaps Even After Years of Recovery
articles.snippet: Only 25 states have passed budgets for the coming year, and many of the bitterest fights are not between the two parties, but between conservative and centrist Republicans.
articles.abstract: Only 25 states have passed budgets for the coming year, and many of the bitterest fights are not between the two parties, but between conservative and centrist Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — In Illinois, fights over the state budget and its $3 billion shortfall have hit such an impasse that Gov. Bruce Rauner, a Republican, issued a dire warning last week that a “major, major restructuring of the government” was around the corner.

articles.headline: HackerOne Connects Hackers With Companies, and Hopes for a Win-Win
articles.snippet: HackerOne’s co-founders are betting they can persuade the world’s hackers to spend their free time solving security’s problems, not causing them, and that businesses will pay them a bounty for their service.
articles.abstract: HackerOne’s co-founders are betting they can persuade the world’s hackers to spend their free time solving security’s problems, not causing them, and that businesses will pay them a bounty for their service.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In 2011, two Dutch hackers in their early 20s made a target list of 100 high-tech companies they would try to hack. Soon, they had found security vulnerabilities in Facebook, Google, Apple, Microsoft, Twitter and 95 other companies’ systems.

articles.headline: Russia Uses Money and Ideology to Fight Western Sanctions
articles.snippet: Moscow is leveraging its economic power, financing European political parties and movements, and spreading alternative accounts of the conflict.
articles.abstract: Moscow is leveraging its economic power, financing European political parties and movements, and spreading alternative accounts of the conflict.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The war in Ukraine that has pitted Russia against the West is being waged not just with tanks, artillery and troops. Increasingly, Moscow has brought to bear different kinds of weapons, according to American and European officials: money, ideology and disinformation.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Steven Erlanger

articles.headline: ‘Straight Outta Compton’ Film Plays a Role in Suge Knight Murder Case
articles.snippet: A video attached to a trailer for the film is a focal point in a murder and attempted murder case against the music entrepreneur.
articles.abstract: A video attached to a trailer for the film is a focal point in a murder and attempted murder case against the music entrepreneur.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — In an editing room here, filmmakers are wrestling with a final cut of “Straight Outta Compton,” Universal Pictures’ new movie about the outlaw rap group N.W.A.

articles.headline: Behind Scott Walker, a Longstanding Conservative Alliance Against Unions
articles.snippet: More than his potential rivals, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is a product of a loose network that has spent years laying the groundwork for a politician who can promote its ideas.
articles.abstract: More than his potential rivals, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is a product of a loose network that has spent years laying the groundwork for a politician who can promote its ideas.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis. — Less than a week after he was elected governor of Wisconsin in 2010, Scott Walker went to Milwaukee at the invitation of his political patron, Michael W. Grebe.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Monica Davey

articles.headline: Going to the Ends of the Earth to Get the Most Out of Music
articles.snippet: The music publisher Kobalt believes it can make more money for its artists by simplifying the way money flows around the world from every click, download and stream.
articles.abstract: The music publisher Kobalt believes it can make more money for its artists by simplifying the way money flows around the world from every click, download and stream.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the music industry’s hunt for royalties, no digital nook or cranny is too small to scour for income — even for the biggest hits.

articles.headline: Evangelicals Open Door to Debate on Gay Rights
articles.snippet: Encouraged by younger Christians and cultural shifts, some church leaders are having what they describe as unprecedented discussions about homosexuality.
articles.abstract: Encouraged by younger Christians and cultural shifts, some church leaders are having what they describe as unprecedented discussions about homosexuality.
articles.lead_paragraph: LA MIRADA, Calif. — As a young, gay Christian activist, Matthew Vines considered it a victory just to get into a room at a conservative Christian university here with four influential evangelicals who disagreed with him over what the Bible says about homosexuality.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Backs White House on Jerusalem Passport Dispute
articles.snippet: The justices, ruling 6 to 3, rejected an attempt by Congress to require the State Department to indicate in passports that Jerusalem is part of Israel.
articles.abstract: The justices, ruling 6 to 3, rejected an attempt by Congress to require the State Department to indicate in passports that Jerusalem is part of Israel.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In an important separation-of-powers case, the Supreme Court on Monday struck down a law that would have allowed American parents of children born in Jerusalem to obtain passports saying the children were born in Israel. The president, rather than Congress, must determine national policy on the status of Jerusalem, the majority said.

articles.headline: Iceland to Lift Capital Controls Imposed After Financial Crisis
articles.snippet: The release of the capital controls will be watched carefully as an important case study in how to manage a crisis.
articles.abstract: The release of the capital controls will be watched carefully as an important case study in how to manage a crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: REYKJAVIK, Iceland — After Iceland imposed capital controls during the global financial crisis, the move helped stabilize the country’s banking system, putting the economy on a path to recovery.
articles.byline: By Jenny Anderson and Chad Bray

articles.headline: Uber Spends Heavily to Establish Itself in China
articles.snippet: Faced with homegrown competition in China, the ride-hailing service is offering its Chinese drivers bonuses of up to three times fares.
articles.abstract: Faced with homegrown competition in China, the ride-hailing service is offering its Chinese drivers bonuses of up to three times fares.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Uber is spending money at a breakneck rate to crack the China market — even paying its drivers more than the fares they collect.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: A Raid on ISIS Yields a Trove of Intelligence
articles.snippet: Laptops, cellphones and other materials were seized in a Delta Force commando operation in Syria last month, officials said.
articles.abstract: Laptops, cellphones and other materials were seized in a Delta Force commando operation in Syria last month, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American intelligence agencies have extracted valuable information about the Islamic State’s leadership structure, financial operations and security measures by analyzing materials seized during a Delta Force commando raid last month that killed a leader of the terrorist group in eastern Syria, according to United States officials.
